parts.text:
```xml
<output>
<analysis>
<has-cmf>TRUE</has-cmf>
<refers-to-candidate>TRUE. The post explicitly mentions "Șandor Ovidiu," identifying him as a candidate for senator on the PRA party list.  It also mentions Mircea Geoană, although the connection is less direct (support for the party). </refers-to-candidate>
<addresses-the-wide-population>TRUE. This is a paid Facebook post, inherently designed for broad public reach. The hashtags further suggest a wide audience targeting (#Mehedinți #DrobetaTurnuSeverin #Orșova #Strehaia #Alegeri2024).</addresses-the-wide-population>
<electoral-objective>TRUE. The post aims to promote Șandor Ovidiu's candidacy for senator. While it touches upon a social issue (drug consumption), this is clearly framed within the context of his political platform and intended to garner support for his election. The mention of Mircea Geoană's support further strengthens this objective.</electoral-objective>
<journalism>FALSE. While the post mentions a social issue, it lacks the objectivity and journalistic standards expected of news reporting. It's primarily promotional material for a political candidate.</journalism>
<personal_opinion>FALSE. The content is not a personal opinion; it's a structured political advertisement promoting a candidate and his party.</personal_opinion>
</analysis>

<conclusion>
<post_id>1356474952001168</post_id>
<electoral-propaganda-analysis>
The Facebook post fulfills all the criteria for electoral propaganda as defined by Article 36 (7) of LEGE nr. 334 din 17 iulie 2006. It directly refers to a candidate (Șandor Ovidiu), is used during the electoral campaign period (judging by the hashtags and context), has a clear electoral objective (promoting the candidate), and goes beyond simple journalistic reporting. The presence of a CMF number further confirms its nature as electoral propaganda.  The paid nature of the post on a public platform like Facebook reinforces its intention to reach a wide audience.  The mention of Mircea Geoană, while not explicitly endorsing, implicitly links the candidate to a known figure within the party, further enhancing the propaganda effect.
</electoral-propaganda-analysis>
<electoral-propaganda-decision>TRUE</electoral-propaganda-decision>
<electoral-propaganda-candidates>
  <candidate><name>Șandor Ovidiu</name><impact>POSITIVE</impact></candidate>
</electoral-propaganda-candidates>
<responsible-party-or-group>PRA</responsible-party-or-group>
<message-for-police>
Partidul RomânIa în Acțiune Mehedinți, pentru încălcarea articolului 98 t) din LEGEA nr. 208 din 20 iulie 2015, prin publicarea, după ora 18:00 pe 23.11.2024, a unei postări pe Facebook (ID: 1356474952001168) cu caracter de propagandă electorală, care promovează candidatura domnului Șandor Ovidiu pentru funcția de senator. Postarea, care a beneficiat de o investiție financiară de 1000-1500 RON,  și a atins o audiență estimată la 100.000-500.000 de persoane,  conține elemente de propagandă electorală, inclusiv menționarea sprijinului lui Mircea Geoană,  și depășește limitele jurnalismului, având ca obiectiv influențarea votului în favoarea candidatului PRA.  Prezența codului CMF: 11240040 confirmă natura electorală a postării.  Contact: part9419@partidulromaniainactiunemehedinti.info, +40743302640, https://partidulromaniainactiunemehedinti.info/.
</message-for-police>
</conclusion>
</output>
```
